text: Travel increases your chance of getting and spreading #COVID19. If you get sick and need to go to the hospital, resources may be limited in some destinations. Before you make travel plans, check the COVID-19 risk at your destination: https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T

Most destinations have a Level 3 Travel Health Notice. CDC recommends people avoid all nonessential travel to Level 3 destinations. Before you make travel plans, check the #COVID19 risk at your destination: https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T
Thinking about traveling? Check out CDC’s tips to avoid getting and spreading #COVID19 in common travel situations: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

Slow the spread of #COVID19. Anticipate your needs before you travel: • Bring a mask to wear in public places. • Pack hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol. • Bring enough of your medicine to last you for the entire trip. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

If traveling internationally, check with officials at your destination or the @TravelGov Country Information page for details about entry requirements and restrictions for arriving travelers. https://bit.ly/2JQaGPL

Thinking about traveling? Before you go, consider the following: • Is #COVID19 spreading at your destination? • Are you more likely to get very ill from COVID-19? For more considerations, visit https://bit.ly/2IZicXj.

You can get #COVID19 during your travels. You might feel well and not have any symptoms, but you may still spread COVID-19 to others. If you travel, learn how to protect yourself and others: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj
Thinking about traveling? Don’t travel if you are sick or if you have been around someone with #COVID19 in the past 14 days. Don’t travel with someone who is sick. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

If you travel, follow state, local, and territorial travel requirements. For up-to-date information, check state, territorial, tribal and local health departments’ guidance where you are, along your route, and where you are going. https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

Travel increases your chance of getting and spreading #COVID19. Staying home is the best way to protect yourself and others. If you travel, learn how to avoid getting and spreading COVID-19 in common travel situations: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj
Travel increases your chances of getting and spreading #COVID19. To protect yourself and others, you may want to rethink your travel. https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T
Looking for #COVID19 risk in a certain destination? Check out CDC’s COVID-19 travel recommendations for each country: https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T

Travel increases your chance of getting and spreading #COVID19. If you get sick in a country with a Level 3 Travel Health Notice and need to go to the hospital, resources may be limited. Avoid nonessential travel. Check the COVID-19 risk: https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T
CDC is helping travelers understand the #COVID19 risk in each country. Before you make travel plans, check the COVID-19 risk at your destination: https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T

Travel increases your chance of getting and spreading #COVID19. If you get sick and need to go to the hospital, resources may be limited in some countries. Before you make travel plans, check the COVID-19 risk at your destination: https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T

Most countries have a Level 3 Travel Health Notice. CDC recommends people avoid all nonessential travel to Level 3 countries. Before you make travel plans, check the #COVID19 risk at your destination: https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T
Travel increases your chances of getting and spreading #COVID19. To protect yourself and others, you may want to rethink your travel. https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T
Travel increases your chance of getting and spreading #COVID19. If you have international travel plans, learn about the COVID-19 risk at your destination. https://bit.ly/2VUHX1T
Travel increases your chances of getting and spreading #COVID19. Staying home is the best way to protect yourself and others from getting sick. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

Travel increases your chances of getting and spreading #COVID19. CDC advises against nonessential international travel. If you travel, when you get home you should stay home for 14 days, monitor your health & practice social distancing. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2z39o1B

Avoiding all nonessential international travel helps protect those you love, including people at increased risk for severe illness. See FAQs about international travel during the #COVID19 outbreak. https://bit.ly/2XiBi1q

Is it safe to travel to visit family or friends? - Travel increases your chances of getting & spreading COVID-19. Traveling to visit family may be especially dangerous if you or your loved ones are more likely to get very ill from #COVID19. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

If you travel, follow state and local travel guidance and restrictions. For up-to-date information, check the state or local health department where you are, along your route, and at your planned destination. Slow the spread of #COVID19. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

Staying home is the best way to slow the spread of #COVID19. It can be hard to remain apart from loved ones during challenging or stressful times, but try to connect with them in other ways, using video chats or phone calls. https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

If you travel, be aware that some businesses may be closed. Anticipate your needs: • Bring enough of your meds to last the entire trip. • Use hand sanitizer. • Wear a cloth face covering in public. • Pack food & water.
If you travel, take these steps to protect yourself & others from #COVID19 during your trip. https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

Is car travel safer than air travel? - We don’t know if one type of travel is safer than others. We do know that travel increases your chances of getting and spreading #COVID19. If you decide to travel, plan ahead. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

Travel increases your chances of getting and spreading #COVID19. CDC advises against nonessential international travel. If you must travel, know that some healthcare systems are overwhelmed & adequate medical care may be limited. For more, visit https://bit.ly/2HqjXft.

Only people currently residing in Saudi Arabia are permitted to perform Hajj due to the ongoing #COVID19 pandemic. To limit the risk of getting COVID-19, CDC recommends that Americans already in Saudi Arabia not make the pilgrimage this year. Learn more: https://bit.ly/31rXDgP
CDC advises against nonessential international travel. If you travel, know that your plans may be disrupted & your return to the US could be delayed. For more, see https://bit.ly/2HqjXft.
Travel increases your chances of getting and spreading #COVID19. Staying home is the best way to protect yourself and others from getting sick. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2IZicXj

It can be difficult to practice social distancing when attending mass gatherings, such as Hajj. This can increase a person’s risk of becoming infected with #COVID19. If you are an American in Saudi Arabia, CDC recommends not performing Hajj this year. https://bit.ly/31rXDgP

Is it safe to go camping? - Going camping can pose a risk if you come in close contact w/ others or share public facilities, like restrooms or picnic areas. Exposure may be especially unsafe if you are more likely to get very ill from #COVID19. https://bit.ly/2IZicXj
